children.text: Fold the sleeve hem under to your desired length using a mirror.
Place the pin at the highest point to ensure it does not flop down.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.
Please use a similar item with the same structure and style, where the shoulder seams sit in the same position. This will ensure we can match the arm length accurately when shortening the sleeves.
Please specify the amount you would like removed, or measure from the armhole to the bottom of the sleeve.
Fold the hem under to your desired length using a mirror.
Place the pin at the highest point to ensure it does not flop down.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.

Please use a similar item that fits you well and falls in a comparable way, made from a closely matching material. We will measure the dimensions of the top to ensure it matches the desired length. However, if these variables differ significantly, it may affect the final outcome.
Please specify the amount you would like removed from the hem or measure from the top of the neckline to where you would like the hem to land.
Pinch either side of the sweatshirt/hoodie or the centre back, to adjust it to your desired fit.
Pin from the middle of the adjustment area upwards to the top and downwards to the hem.
Follow the side seams or back seams for accurate pinning.
Ensure the same amount is taken in from top to bottom, unless tapering is specifically required.
Please choose a reference item in a very close style with a skirt that fits you the way you want the altered item to fit.
Pinch either side of the skirt or the centre back, just below the waistband, to adjust it to your desired fit.
Pin from the middle of the adjustment area upwards to the top and downwards to the hem.
Follow the side seams or back seams for accurate pinning.
Ensure the same amount is taken in from top to bottom, unless tapering is specifically requested.
Do not pin leather skirts
as this will leave permanent puncture marks.
If your skirt has a vent
, ensure it is pinned securely down to maintain alignment.
If you'd like adjustments to both the waist and the sides
, please book this as a separate service.
Please choose a reference item in a very close style with a skirt that fits you the way you want the altered item to fit.
Pinch the back seam or both side seams of the waistband to the desired fit.
Secure the adjustment with a safety pin.
If the adjustment is larger than 1 inch, pinch the back seam or side seams further down the garment.
Gradually pin along the seams until the fabric is evenly adjusted.
Use a small safety pin to secure the point where the seams meet.

Please choose a reference item in a very close style with a waistband that fits you the way you want the altered item to fit. We will adjust your garment so that its waistband sits in the same position on your body.
Please specify the amount you would like removed or provide your waist measurement.
Wear the correct shoes or stand barefoot for floor-length pinning.
Fold the hem under to your desired length using a mirror.
Place the pin at the highest point to ensure it does not flop down.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.

Choose a similar item of clothing that fits you well and matches the style of the garment you want altered. Ensure it fits the way you’d like the altered item to fit and sits similarly on your body for accurate comparison.
Ask a friend or family member to help.
Put on the skirt and leave the fastening open where they feel tight.
Measure the gap between the edges of the opening.
Use this measurement to determine how much fabric to add.
Pinch the back seam or both side seams of the waistband to the desired fit.
Secure the adjustment with a safety pin.
If the adjustment is larger than 1 inch, pinch the back seam or side seams further down the garment.
Gradually pin along the seams until the fabric is evenly adjusted.
Use a small safety pin to secure the point where the seams meet.

Please choose a reference item in a very close style with a waistband that fits you the way you want the altered item to fit. We will adjust your garment so that its waistband sits in the same position on your body.
Please specify the amount you would like removed or provide your waist measurement.
Start at the hem:
Pinch the fabric at the bottom of the hem where you’d like the tapering to begin and place a pin there.
Work upwards:
Continue pinching and pinning up the leg, ensuring you remove an equal amount of fabric on both sides for an even taper.
Pin to the desired point:
Pin up to your knee or hip, depending on where you’d like the tapering to stop.
Taper off gradually:
Allow the pinning to blend smoothly back into the original seam for a natural finish.
Please use a similar item with the same style and fit as the one you want altered. It should sit in a similar position on your body, as we will use it to match the tapering.
Please measure the maximum amount you would like taken in from the leg. We will taper this gradually to blend into the original seam.
Fold the hem under to your desired length using a mirror.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Pin one leg and we will match the other.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.

Choose a similar item of clothing that fits you well and matches the style of the garment you want altered. Ensure it fits the way you’d like the altered item to fit and sits similarly on your body for accurate comparison.
Ask a friend or family member to help.
Put on the shorts and leave the fastening open where they feel tight.
Measure the gap between the edges of the opening.
Use this measurement to determine how much fabric to add.
Fold the hem under to your desired length using a mirror.
Place the pin at the highest point to ensure it does not flop down.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.
Pinch either side of the waist coat or the centre back, to adjust it to your desired fit.
Pin from the middle of the adjustment area upwards to the top and downwards to the hem.
Follow the side seams or back seams for accurate pinning.
Ensure the same amount is taken in from top to bottom, unless tapering is specifically requested.
Please choose a reference item in a very close style with a skirt that fits you the way you want the altered item to fit.
Pinch the top of the shoulder seam
to bring it inwards until it sits where you’d like it to land.
Secure the adjustment
by placing a pin through the pinched area to hold it in place.
Please ensure this item has similar shoulders and arm structure so it can be matched accurately.
Pinch the top of the shoulder seam to bring it inwards until it sits at your desired position. Measure the width of the pinched area.

Place the pin at the highest point to ensure it does not flop down.
Pin the front, sides, and back to secure the fold evenly.
Check the length in the mirror and adjust if needed.

Put on the dress and leave the fastening open where they feel tight.
Measure the gap between the edges of the opening.
Use this measurement to determine how much fabric to add.
Lift one strap to adjust the neckline to the desired position.
Pin through both layers of the strap to secure it.
Repeat with the other strap, ensuring both are equal.
Check the straps are even and the neckline is balanced.
Pinch the strap to the desired length, then measure the amount of fabric being pinched.
